level.text: The members of the Board who conduct the hearing shall render their decision, in writing, as soon as practicable, but no later than ninety (90) days after the date that the hearing is completed.
The decision of the Board shall contain the following:
Findings of fact made by the Board;
Application by the Board of the provisions of the statutes and this chapter to the facts as found by the Board;
The decision of the Board based upon findings of fact and the application of the law;
A statement informing the person concerned of his or her right to have the Board’s decision reviewed by the District of Columbia Court of Appeals; and
A statement regarding the time within which a judicial review of the Board’s decision by the District of Columbia Court of Appeals shall be sought.
Within ten (10) days after the Board renders its written decision, the Board shall serve a copy of the written decision upon the person concerned, or his or her attorney of record.
